00029 #ifndef SC_EVENT_QUEUE_H
00030 #define SC_EVENT_QUEUE_H
00031

00033 /*
00034   Class sc_event_queue
00035 
00036   A queue that can contain any number of pending notifications.
00037   The queue has a similiar interface like an sc_event but has different
00038   semantics: it can carry any number of pending notification. The
00039   general rule is that _every_ call to notify() will cause a 
00040   corresponding trigger at the specified wall-clock time that can be
00041   observed (the only exception is when notifications are explicitly
00042   cancelled). 
00043 
00044   If multiple notifications are pending at the same wall-clock
00045   time, then the event queue will trigger in different delta cycles
00046   in order to ensure that sensitive processes can notice each
00047   trigger. The first trigger happens in the earliest delta cycle
00048   possible which is the same behavior as a normal timed event.
00049   
00050 */
00051

00107     //

00109     //

00133 inline
00134 void sc_event_queue::notify (double when, sc_time_unit base )

00136         notify( sc_time(when,base) );
